did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, records (documents), photographs, audiovisual materials, case files, transcripts, architectural drawings (visual works), memorabilia, bibliographies, correspondence, manuscript (documents) .
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract:
Photographs of the ILR library building dedication, tours of new space, dedication dinner, and honored guests.
Audio recording of the 25th anniversary celebration of the Martin P. Catherwood Library.
Correspondence generated in the process of building the Current Documents collection at the Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives.
Consists of subject files, reports, and administrative files.
Transcript of a recording made at the New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations Management Open House, July 27, 1962.
Martin P. Catherwood Academic Robe, Hood and Cap
Letter from Martin P. Catherwood to Joseph Raffel, Senior Industrial Investigator for the New York State Department of Labor, March 13, 1963.
Consists of list of materials placed on reserve by the faculty, arranged by semester.
Martin P. Catherwood photos, construction, employees, stacks, office spaces
Oversize architectural drawings - Library Plans
The former Dean of the New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations collection of plaques, paper weights, book ends, and other memorabilia.
Papers of Martin P. Catherwood, including correspondence and speeches, mostly from either before or after his time as the Dean of the ILR School. Papers from his time as Dean mostly concern NYC Transit.
did.langmaterial: Collection material in English, French, German, Dutch, Portuguese

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Few members of Cornell's faculty have served the University, New York State, and the Ithaca community with such devotion and distinction as Martin P. Catherwood. To these employments he brought energy, probing Intelligence, administrative skills, and close knowledge of industry, labor, and government.

As a result of the close working relationship that had developed between the State Planning Board and the Joint Legislative Committee on Industrial and Labor Conditions headed by Irving M. Ives, the majority leader of the Assembly, the legislature created the Division of Commerce as of May 1, 1941. Governor Herbert H. Lehman appointed Catherwood as the first commissioner of commerce and Governor Thomas E. Dewey continued him in that office. In this important and pioneering post, Catherwood set the foundations and structure for the division that it has retained ever since.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of photographs of the ILR library building dedication, tours of new space, dedication dinner, and honored guests.
The correspondence is from various management and labor organizations in response to inquries for copies of collective bargaining agreements, personnel policies, and other documents.

This transcript was made on the occasion of the New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations Management Open House, July 27, 1962. It was reviewed by Martin P. Catherwood in August 1966 and includes his edits.
This collection includes many certificates, personal correspondence, many photographs. Covers the period 1902 to his death (1978)

This collection consists of a single letter written by Martin P. Catherwood, Industrial Commissioner for the New York State Department of Labor, to Joseph Raffel, Senior Industrial Investigator for the New York State Department of Labor, concerning Mr Raffel's completion of a staff development seminar at Cornell University. The original cover is included. The lack of a stamp or post mark on the cover indicates that the letter may have been hand delivered.
The donor, Mr Raffel's granddaughter, included one of Mr Raffel's business cards.

This collection consist of correspondence, memoranda, reports, and other materials from the files of Philip Dankert. The files pertain to Labor Studies, Baruch College ILR Masters Program, Metropolitan District Office Library, Rochester Extension Office Library, Buffalo Extension Office Library, Capital District Extension Office, and the Neufeld Project.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.
